chapters.title: A Tutorial Introduction
chapters.chapter_summary: Provides a hands-on tutorial introduction to Python covering basic syntax, data types, control flow, functions, and object-oriented programming. Serves as a quick-start guide for new Python programmers. [^1]

chapters.title: Lexical Conventions and Syntax
chapters.chapter_summary: Covers Python's lexical structure including tokens, identifiers, keywords, literals, operators, delimiters, and indentation rules. Discusses encoding, comments, and the fundamental syntax rules of the language. [^20]

chapters.title: Types and Objects
chapters.chapter_summary: Examines Python's type system and object model in detail, covering built-in types (integers, floats, strings, lists, tuples, dictionaries, sets), mutability, object identity, and memory management including garbage collection. [^39]

chapters.title: Operators and Expressions
chapters.chapter_summary: Details all Python operators and expression evaluation including arithmetic, comparison, logical, bitwise, and assignment operators. Covers operator precedence, associativity, and special behaviors like short-circuit evaluation. [^58]

chapters.title: Program Structure
chapters.chapter_summary: Explores Python's program structure including statements, blocks, conditionals (if/elif/else), loops (while/for), exception handling (try/except), and context managers. Emphasizes proper control flow and error handling. [^77]

chapters.title: Functions and Functional Programming
chapters.chapter_summary: Comprehensive coverage of functions including parameter passing, return values, closures, decorators, lambda functions, and functional programming concepts. Discusses scope rules, recursion, and advanced function features. [^96]

chapters.title: Classes and Object-Oriented Programming
chapters.chapter_summary: In-depth treatment of object-oriented programming in Python covering class definition, inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation, special methods (magic methods), properties, and metaclasses. Includes method resolution order (MRO). [^115]

chapters.title: Modules, Packages, and Distribution
chapters.chapter_summary: Covers Python's module and package system including import mechanisms, namespace management, package structure, relative vs absolute imports, and distribution using setuptools. Discusses best practices for code organization. [^134]

chapters.title: Input and Output
chapters.chapter_summary: Examines file and I/O operations including opening, reading, writing files, encoding handling, binary vs text mode, buffering, and working with standard streams (stdin, stdout, stderr). [^153]

chapters.title: Execution Environment
chapters.chapter_summary: Explores the Python execution environment including the sys and os modules, process management, threading, multiprocessing, signal handling, command-line arguments, and interpreter interaction. [^172]

chapters.title: Testing, Debugging, Profiling, and Tuning
chapters.chapter_summary: Covers testing, debugging, and performance optimization including unittest framework, doctest, pdb debugger, profiling tools (cProfile, timeit), and techniques for code optimization and performance tuning. [^191]

chapters.title: Built-In Functions
chapters.chapter_summary: Reference guide to Python's built-in functions covering type conversions, iteration functions (map, filter, zip), introspection (dir, isinstance, callable), eval/exec, and other essential built-in utilities. [^210]

chapters.title: Python Runtime Services
chapters.chapter_summary: Comprehensive reference to Python's runtime services covering essential standard library modules including sys, os, io, pickle, threading, multiprocessing, subprocess, signals, garbage collection, and more. This is a detailed library reference section. [^228]

chapters.title: Mathematics
chapters.chapter_summary: Reference guide to mathematical and numeric modules including math, decimal, fractions, random, statistics, array, itertools, and functools. Covers mathematical operations, random number generation, and numeric utilities. [^245]
